title: Period of SHM - pendulum frequency in elevator

content.question: A pendulum consists of a sphere suspended from a string with negligible mass. When the sphere is displaced by a small angle and released, the sphere undergoes simple harmonic motion with a frequency <math alttext="f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The pendulum is then taken into an elevator that is accelerating upward with an acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="a equals 0.21 g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.21</mn><mi>g</mi></math>. If the pendulum is displaced by the same small angle while in the elevator and released, the frequency of its oscillation will be most nearly

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
